articles.title: Discovery of '2000-year-old computer' leaves scientists baffled - indy100
articles.description:
Scientists have been left baffled by the discovery of the wreck of a 2,000-year-old “computer” that is amazingly complex.
The Antikythera mechanism – an astronomical calendar – has been dubbed “‘the first computer” and has baffled scientists for generations a…

articles.author: Katie Pickles
articles.title: Breast cancer breakthrough with new AI that can predict if disease will spread - Daily Mail
articles.description: Researchers from King's College London developed an AI model which they tested on more than 5,000 lymph nodes, donated by 345 patients.
articles.content:
Scientists have developed artificial intelligence which can predict if a patients breast cancer will spread.
The technology measures the immune response of lymph nodes, pea-sized lumps of tissue whi… [+3035 chars]

articles.author: HT Tech
articles.title: New volatile sunspot grows 4 times bigger than the Earth; Will it unleash a solar storm? - HT Tech
articles.description: A new sunspot has emerged on the Sun, which has grown overnight to gain a size four times the size of the Earth. The sunspot likely harbors an unstable magnetic field and can explode, sparking a solar storm.
articles.content: As astronomers continue to monitor the sunspot AR3311 for any signs of eruption, a new sunspot is making a mark on the Sun. This new sunspot was practically invisible to the telescopes of NASA and th… [+2854 chars]
